website_summaries.verdict: The ideal tool if you have to get through bolts, rods, padlocks, wires, and chains to get the job done.
pros: Can get through rods up to one-fourth inch and has a strong handle that is designed to maximize comfort during use
The compound cutting action makes it even easier to wield and takes some of the stress off the user
Features good leverage, but you might want to consider larger sizes for bigger projects
cons: You're losing on some quality, but the price point is enticing

customer_reviews.title: Enabled me to steal my bike back from a local bike gang.
customer_reviews.text: Top Ratings, 5-stars. I never knew how easy it would be to break through two bike locks. Spending six weeks aggressively hunting down the local street gang that stole my sisters bike was the hardest part of the whole ordeal, sneaking into their home in the middle of the night was also harrowing. Using this tool to snap through the locks was butter smooth, and oddly satisfying. Very easy to do. 10/10 would liberate a bike again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did not cut
customer_reviews.text: Unless I forgot how to use bolt cutters, this product is useless. I believe my padlock is 1/4”. Even if it’s 5/16”, I should have been able to do more damage than is shown in the photos. I put all of my strength and weight into making a cut, and attempted this 5 times to no avail. Also, the rubber handle “grips” slide around.
customer_reviews.author: S. Beale

customer_reviews.title: Great and Compact
customer_reviews.text: Used it to cut a jammed master lock that I had in my storage. Love how compact it is.
customer_reviews.author: L.R

customer_reviews.title: Easily cut up mattress and box spring with 18" cutter
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 18" cutters to cut up a mattress and box spring. It cut through all the steel with little effort. Threw the fabric and metal in garbage can and the wood in the fire. Gone in one pickup.
customer_reviews.author: S. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Cut through chain link fencing like butter
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these bolt cutters to cut away chain link fencing from some stumps that had grown up into the fencing. These bolt cutters worked great! The compact size made them easy to use and the grips on the handles gave me good leverage. I have not tried to use them on anything else yet but I think that they would be able to cut through thicker metal also. Very pleased with them and one less thing I need to borrow from my neighbor!
customer_reviews.author: Cinnamon Driver

customer_reviews.title: made well and have a comfortable grip. Price is comparable to ones you would ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my bug-out bag because going thru fences is far less dangerous than going over fences. These are solid, made well and have a comfortable grip. Price is comparable to ones you would purchase at a place like Harbor Freight Tools but the quality is probably a notch or two above.
customer_reviews.author: The Contingency Plan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home use
customer_reviews.text: Excellent size and weight. Used to clip broken links on the fence already. Cuts chain-link fences like a hot knife through butter. Perfect for household and light commercial use.
customer_reviews.author: This Is Us

customer_reviews.title: Great lock buster
customer_reviews.text: Love it, used it to get rid of a Master lock at my brothers house (he lost the keys) and was able to help him out.
customer_reviews.author: Freddy Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Cuts steel like butter
customer_reviews.text: I had an old, rusty chain link fence to dismantle. That project took several hundred cuts, yet from the first to the last it was quick and easy with no perceptible degradation in sharpness or cutting power. I also used the bolt cutter to remove an old padlock that had rusted shut at the gate. In retrospect I should have done that first since it was the thickest, most challenging cut, but even after all the prior use it made no difference at all. That final cut was smooth and easy. All-in-all this Workpro bolt cutter is a very useful and robust tool. I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: L. A. Kane

customer_reviews.title: Not for padlocks!!!
customer_reviews.text: Tried to cut a standard padlock today at work and they were not capable. There seems to be two reasons. First, the jaws don’t seem to open enough to get the bar to the inner most pinch point. Second, the cutting edge is simply too soft of material. Guessing they could cut a fence (1/16 or 1/8) but they are not able to cut a padlock (3/16 or 1/4).
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Brian Dean

customer_reviews.title: couldn't cut a master lock
customer_reviews.text: I have a big paper weight now. This would not cut a fairly basic master lock (which I lost the key).
customer_reviews.author: Picard

customer_reviews.title: Great product and nice fit
customer_reviews.text: Unless you’re as strong as thanos you’re probably gonna need a pair of these bad boys to break a master lock. It took a good 3 tries to break that old lock on my rear house gate entrance,but with a good grip and some nice gloves and cold water to drink it did the trick. I recommend it to any handyman trying to save a few bucks instead of paying for a locksmith.
customer_reviews.author: Robby Pouchie

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on the first lock
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on the first lock. Def built solid and smal enough to be compact and not heavy. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Barnes

customer_reviews.title: The metal chipped, WorkPro never answered
customer_reviews.text: Had these for one day. Could not cut a master lock and the metal chipped on the cutters. One cut and their already knicked and chipped. Poor quality. Honestly I’m glad it happened sooner than later so I can send them back Edit: Unfortunately it’s been too long to return them and WorkPro ignored my emails. I do not recommend this company
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Not real strong
customer_reviews.text: Not real strong. Cutting through mild "gate locking" chain takes 2 to 3 tries. Can't see it cutting anything hardened like a lock shackle but I haven't tried it. Next time I'll likely go to Northern and handle what I'm buying first.
customer_reviews.author: your name

customer_reviews.title: This worked great for getting it off our shed
customer_reviews.text: My daughter broke the key for our deadbolt off while trying to open it. This worked great for getting it off our shed!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Made short work of a home project
customer_reviews.text: I had a bunch of wire hangers to cut up for a home project, and these wire cutters did a great job. I'm petite and have little-to-no grip strength, so traditional wire cutters hurt my hands to use (and didn't do a very good job). These were easy to use, and cut through the hangers quickly and cleanly. The shipping was fast; the item was securely packed and is accurately represented by the listing on Amazon. I don't think I'll need to buy these again (good workmanship), but feel secure in recommending that you do. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Cantrell-Kraig

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great for Cutting 1/4 Inch Lock
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 18" bolt cutter mainly to cut the shackle (1/4") of a lockbox left by a realtor. Initially, I thought this might not work since the handles were only 18" - I tried to get the cheapest, best reviewed bolt cutter for the size shackle I wanted to cut. The shackle snapped after about 3 seconds of pressure. I held one handle against my shoulder and used two hands on the other handle. After the cut, the cutting blade wasn't bent or chipped. I'm surprised this worked so well!
customer_reviews.author: Shadow of a Dream

customer_reviews.title: longer handles make the job easier
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cut through cattle fencing that was about 1/4" thick wire. It did the job really well. I had contemplated getting the smaller cutters and am glad I did not. It still took me a bit of pressure to cut thru the fencing but it would have been much harder with shorter cutters. The key is to get the wire back as far as possible in the "jaws" of the cutter to make it easier. I'm a 56 y.o. woman. A younger / stronger person will have absolutely no trouble at all.
customer_reviews.author: Aly B

customer_reviews.title: Works great!! Reasonable price!
customer_reviews.text: Cut 1/2 inch cable lock with little or no effort. This is the 30 inch model. This is a must buy if you ever need a bolt or cable cutter.
customer_reviews.author: Rock Barras

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: First piece of chain they cut dimpled the jaws- you get what you pay for..I will be returning mine
customer_reviews.author: wwtp1347

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I need to cut a lot of stuff.... often. Bought these to replace my 20+ year old cutters from Big R. Man, this works great. I got the longest one available. I used it a few days ago to cut a cable bike lock on a gate. All my buddies kept saying it wouldn't do it. They were wrong. Honestly I am not strong enough to use this to it's full potential, but hey , that's why I have younger guys that work for me. VERY happy.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Wow - worked great - like cutting through butter!
customer_reviews.text: I had ten old heavy-duty tomato cages laying around that I had spray-painted camouflage green. I don't grow tomatoes, but I saved the cages because I wanted to shorten them in order to use them to support a hedge of Annabelle hydrangeas. These cutters worked great! They went through the metal like butter and I was done with my project in five minutes!. I just wish I had ordered these sooner - I am sure they will be handy to have around in the future.
customer_reviews.author: SammaLamma

customer_reviews.title: These are not a heavy duty tool
customer_reviews.text: IF you are looking for something that will actually cut through a lock, don't bother with these...they work for cutting threw screws or wire fencing, etc. If you need to cut off a lock or something heavy duty, get something bigger with more torque.
customer_reviews.author: William Colton Culberson

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Since I'm not a professional thief (just a weekend handyman) I haven't really had to test their limits yet, but so far they've worked well on everything I've thrown at them. They appear to be fairly well built and I would be surprised if I ever had to replace them given the limited amount of use they will see in my lifetime. Seem to be a good value for the money for those of us that just have an occasional need to cut a chain, lock, steel wire, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job for a very fair price
customer_reviews.text: Product was quite adept at cutting double loop chain for a front porch hanging swing. Although the handles are tubular steel rather than solid this did not impact the effectiveness of the tool. I am very pleased with this tool for the job that was at hand.
customer_reviews.author: Bama Fan 2009

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but grip is not secure
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to tear down the metal frames in a mattress and box spring. It worked perfectly for that, easily cutting through the thick, steel springs and supports encountered. The only issue is that the cushioned grips were not secured to the steel handle so twisted when used. I had to constantly recenter the grips while using it. Not a big deal for occasional use but is a nuisance for continuous use
customer_reviews.author: Kerry K

customer_reviews.title: Nice Small Bolt Cutter
customer_reviews.text: I needed to remove some old fencing running through the woods on my property and needed a bolt cutter to clip the staples and cut the sections of barbed wire between trees in which it was embedded. With tight working quarters a small cutter was preferred. This little tool fit the bill. It cuts fence staples and barbed wire with almost no effort and is light and compact, perfect for carrying through the woods.
customer_reviews.author: Photoangler

customer_reviews.title: Did the job, recommend
customer_reviews.text: Nice heavy tool. Worked great to cut down an old large size dog crate. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CKM

customer_reviews.title: Broke first use
customer_reviews.text: First use I attempted to cut a soft 1/4" chain. Cut one side of the link and chunks of the blade sheared off. Now they are useless. My harbor freight bolt cutters worked great for years. Thought these would be an upgrade but they are garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase and recommend this item.
customer_reviews.text: Quality item at a great price comparatively speaking. I’m pretty weak but was able to cut through hard metal wire shelving like butter! I didn’t experience any shifting of the handle covers at all as another reviewer stated was an issue. Nicely packaged with a nice thank you card inside... little things mean a lot and to me this suggests quality customer service. Happy with this purchase and recommend this item. If I need more tools in the future I’ll look for this brand and this seller. I didn’t receive any reward for this review and I was not asked to write it.
customer_reviews.author: lynne

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I bought these so I could cut a small lock off of my gate, a lock usually used for lockers, so pretty small. Should have been easy. My husband and another guy, both pretty strong, couldn’t cut the lock off. We looked at the bolt cutters and they had dented. Cheap materials I assume to not be able to snap that lock. The best thing about these was that I could return them!
customer_reviews.author: Kyla

customer_reviews.title: Worked for the job; but not the safest
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the 18"; needing it for cutting some chain links from a pot rack I had just hung. I would have preferred using a 24", or larger for better leverage, but the 18" did the job. That being said, it was not easy cutting as the handle grips started to turn while I was applying pressure. The more I attempted to close the cutter, the more the grips started twisting (one more than the other). I'll probably have to remove the grips and apply construction adhesive, to ensure I don't have this problem in the future. Quality control isn't what is used to be...
customer_reviews.author: fire1962

customer_reviews.title: Alright or not
customer_reviews.text: Definitely on the cheap side judging from the hallow handles, they seem like a real weak point, but served its purpose so far. Edit. After use changed me rating to 1 star. They completely broke apart cutting my 1st bolt. And blades bent. Total trash. :(
customer_reviews.author: BOYD

customer_reviews.title: Sharp works quite well
customer_reviews.text: We had to remove a master lock on our gate that someone placed there as a joke. Lock was half inch and these cutters snapped off on the first try. Nice comfortable grip. Doesn't tear up your hands. Very little effort used to break lock and I am small only 5'7 125lbs. Quite sturdy and worth the value compared to shopping at Home Depot or Menards
customer_reviews.author: Pip

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Shockingly inexpensive.
customer_reviews.text: We are in our seventies, but we still keep a few farm animals and chickens and maintain extensive fencing for our five dogs, so we have to deal with fencing pretty often. These days, we find it hard to cut fence wire with the typical fencing pliers as we have all our lives: old hands! This things cuts fence wire almost ridiculously easy, and how they produce it for the price is a real baffler. Not sure yet about durability, but so far it's a genuine winner.
customer_reviews.author: RW Emerson

customer_reviews.title: Worked well but blades got nasty dent after first use
customer_reviews.text: I bought these (24" model) as a standby in case I was unable to open any of my padlocks. I used it for the first time (after about 15 months from purchase) on the hardened steel shackle of a lock which was 8mm (5/16") in diameter. It took 3 very hard squeezes to cut the shackle. I looked at the blades of the tool after the use and noticed a nasty dent in them (see image). I don't know if this is expected, but I imagine that it means that the tool won't work well if required to be used often.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: OH YES - Workpro to the rescue
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Privacy Pop Bed Tent. It's a really great product but didn't work for me. I took it apart but never sent it back. Too disassembled to sell. Has lots of long metal rods that are so sturdy they can't be bent so could not get them in our apartment trash bin w/o being noticed. So i bought these bolt cutters. After not doing anything about this for 3 months. my cutters arrived today. First thing was to cut up the rods. Minimal pressure/strength needed and cut right through them. So happy. Thank you, Workpro.
customer_reviews.author: Pickles

customer_reviews.title: Appeared Used, Notable Dent in Metal
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because I needed something robust for cutting various pieces of thick metal used in some yard signs. Unfortunately, upon receiving a "new" item, there was an obvious dent in the metal cutting pieces. Pictures attached, but it's almost as if it were used before.
customer_reviews.author: Team V

customer_reviews.title: More China Crap? Exploded Into Pieces First Time I Used It!
customer_reviews.text: First time out - tried to cut through the shackle on a Master Lock 517D Laminated Padlock with Long Shackle. Have done it lots of times before with hacksaw blade. Was very easy. But with this bolt cutter - first you can achieve no leverage because the arms are too short. Then it won’t bite all the way through the tiny thin shackle. I kept trying and suddenly the tool exploded, sending everything not welded on flying across the room.
customer_reviews.author: M. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Did the job I bought it for
customer_reviews.text: While it did not slice right through the lock like a much more expensive one would it did the job that I bought it for which was getting an average size lock off of my toolbox when I lost the key. It took about five minutes in total. I deducted one star because the plastic handles were slipping a little bit when I put max pressure on them. Hopefully I won't lose anymore keys!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff StrichartTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Cuts Through Metal Like Butter
customer_reviews.text: I had small trellis that a tree had grown through. Without severely cutting back the tree, I would need to cut up the trellis. The Workpro Bolt Cutter made quick work of cutting the trellis into pieces. The thicker pieces needed some extra strength, but that was not surprising. I was able to reduce the trellis into manageable bits in no time. And more poor dogwood wash happy to be liberated from its metal confinement.
customer_reviews.author: A. Silverstone

customer_reviews.title: Did not cut, bent the blade, useless now
customer_reviews.text: We are a school and purchased this to cut locks on lockers for kids who forgot their combination or the lock failed. The first time we tried to use it, not only did it not cut the lock, it bent the blades, so the item is in the trash now.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: This comes with no directions
customer_reviews.text: I have tried to find directions online and the bolt cutters online and even on the manufacturer's website look different. I cannot get the cutter to open all the way and although I managed to loosen the middle bolt enough to open the jaws, it did not cut the swingset chain at all. I would love some help, but if not I will need to return this. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Eliza B

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bolt cutter after getting a 14" model of this same brand. I was very pleased with the smooth and easy operation of this brand as compared other brands. Both this 18" model and the 14" model were superior in ease of use and cutting force. However don't try to cut a hardened padlock with these small sized bolt cutters. Get a 36" set or larger.
customer_reviews.author: Basspro361

customer_reviews.title: Nope!!!
customer_reviews.text: Well that was a waste of money! Don't know if someone used these and then returned and now it's dull...all I know is it didn't work at all!!! Tried on 2 different bolts and wouldn't even cut half way thru! bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the price. The only draw back to this product is right out of the box the grip handles slid off the bolt cutters. I dont plan to use them daily, only nice to have around when you need them, so I dont consider it a big deal. However if you were going to use these on a regular basis I would warn you, you will need to use an adhesive to keep the grips on.
customer_reviews.author: Topgunz1

customer_reviews.title: Not a padlock cutter
customer_reviews.text: I had to remove a Master padlock from a fence gate due to a lost key. Unfortunately, this was not the tool for the job. The lock dented the blades and made them slip sideways. As another reviewer observed, an 18” bolt cutter does not provide enough leverage to cut even a small padlock. These may work better for less intense jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Kundratula

customer_reviews.title: Impressive for its size and price!  See photos!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cut some long thin bolts ( not sure of size -- see photos for scale ) and this tool cut them fairly easily. I did *not* expect it to be able to cut the larger bolt pictured. I was impressed! Initially, I was kind of.forcing it like a pliers but as you squeeze the handles, it's like the tool's own torque takes over. Overall I'm impressed by such a low priced tool. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: bettehead

customer_reviews.title: Great for heavy gauge wire like #3
customer_reviews.text: I used this mostly for cutting wiring will redoing my shop. Mostly cut #3 and #8 AWG wiring. Much easier to use than wire cutters. Good quality with some electrical protection.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I somehow lost the only key I had to the lock on my shed and had to wait for these bolt cutters to be delivered so I could remove the old lock and get out my lawn mower to cut the grass! LOL They arrived yesterday and worked like a knife through butter on the Master padlock. And I'm an older women who is strong, but not a body builder!
customer_reviews.author: GR8DaneMom

customer_reviews.title: They're alright.
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect to cut boron shackles with it, but otherwise they'll do what you need. You'll want some brute force still, though. Even for low-end masterlocks and such. Chipped the jaw on a few locks, but that was my fault for grunting through a dozen random lock shackles. I feel for the price the tool is just fine and it did what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Pirate_Joke

customer_reviews.title: Meets my need
customer_reviews.text: I will start by saying these are my first ever bolt cutters so I cannot compare with others. I mainly bought these for a chain link fence and also some 1/4 inch of so round metal bars. Have not used it for the fence yet but it cut the metal bars with ease, the bars were a softer metal about as round as a metal tent stake which is what I am make with the cut bars. I am happy with the product based on my need.
customer_reviews.author: bmb337

customer_reviews.title: TLDR; I don’t recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a plan B to get my jewelry cut in half because it was stuck in my ear, but it didn’t cut the jewelry surprisingly. These didn’t cut both times I used them, and were a panic buy. I wouldn’t recommend them, unfortunately. I didn’t use them on a lock or a chain though, so maybe that could be the issue, however I doubt it.
customer_reviews.author: Karmel

customer_reviews.title: Not for padlocks -
customer_reviews.text: Good price - good for small metals to cut. Not good to cut a padlock unless you can apply brute force.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: Cut through Masterlock
customer_reviews.text: Did the trick and snapped through a masterlock that went defective and refused to open (masterlock says it stands behind its product and are sending me a new one but they didn’t pay for the bolt cutters).
customer_reviews.author: mom2L

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cutting wire shelving
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 14" cutters for cutting wire closet shelving to length. Still takes a little effort as opposed to a larger set of cutters, but you can't beat the price of these for a quick job. Worth it just to not have to wait on someone in the big box stores to cut to size. Just buy the longer pieces and cut to length at home. I find my cuts are cleaner and more accurate than what the guys do in the store as well.
customer_reviews.author: William Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great leveraged set of jaws.
customer_reviews.text: This is a hefty cutter, and cut through spring steel like it was butter. The arms are much sturdier than I expected, not going to bend or buckle upon quite a bit of muscle applied. The leverage engineered into the jaws is spectacular. Cuts nails like breaking Crayons. Bolts no problem.
customer_reviews.author: SCOTT. S

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to cut barbed wire that was all along the back of my yard. The builder could of done it, but of course, said they would and didn't. They cut through the wire like butter and made it a very easy job. Very good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: avid mystery reader

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: We have a fence where ducks come through a hole at the bottom and they would often get torn up by sharp metal from the fence, so I bought these to widen the hole and remove the sharp edges and they worked great. Now I have only used them once so far, but will update if needed.
customer_reviews.author: DJM76

customer_reviews.title: Work Great!
customer_reviews.text: We are in the process of removing some horrible concrete that was done before we bought our house and there is so mush wire mesh that has needed to be cut.These work great as well as get in tighter spots,unlike larger cutters.My daughter and I can both use them with ease so my husband doesn't have to do all the cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Definitely overkill for what I mostly end up using it for, but cut through bolts I needed to trim like butter. You can't thread anything on to the end it leaves though, just use it after everything's on and in place. Would probably recommend, good tool to have
customer_reviews.author: Olga S.

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Cut like butter! Idiot that I am, I mistakenly locked my backyard gate such that the key hole was facing a wall without enough space to insert the key. This lock is a Master lock, 9/32" diameter with "case hard" printed on it. I am a 5' 7" woman of medium build and I was able to cut through the lock with this bolt cutter using just my arms with a little oomph and no leverage. I can finally access my backyard from the gate again!
customer_reviews.author: J. Kuo

customer_reviews.title: Works Great, Well Made, Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: Just bought a new bed and this was just what I needed to get rid of the old box spring I'd been using with the old bed frame. I got the 18" size, and it cut through the spring with ease so I could dispose of it with with my regular trash collection. With time I'm sure I'll find other uses. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice for the price
customer_reviews.text: They may not be the most industrial of bolt cutters, but they definitely are getting the job done. Spent first evening cutting small diameter mini locks, and some chain portions. Also did some cutting of metal that my snips couldn't handle. Definitely a great choice, especially at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Soandso

customer_reviews.title: Easy use
customer_reviews.text: Cutting 10 gauge wire fencing for multiple projects - just right, not too hard to use and cuts cleanly.
customer_reviews.author: Jjj

customer_reviews.title: Does not cut through a tomato cage
customer_reviews.text: The 14” does not even cut through my tomato cages. Kinda worthless
customer_reviews.author: Specialist

customer_reviews.title: They literally fall apart time and time again.
customer_reviews.text: The bolts holding the head together constantly fall off and loosen, it's really dumb. Beyond that, they work fine. The handles swivel, which I also dislike. They're cheap, that's about the nicest thing I can say.
customer_reviews.author: Evan WalkerTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Don’t even get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I took a gamble on this product knowing that there are plenty of negative reviews about this items ability to cut. Unable to cut 3/16 of an inch. When you clamp it down the two edges turn to the side and the metal gets wedges between the teeth (?). Sent back immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Mackie

customer_reviews.title: Didn't cut through lock
customer_reviews.text: Did Not cut lock I had to buy another one to cut a master lick
customer_reviews.author: Kay Miller

customer_reviews.title: get the biggest you can afford
customer_reviews.text: Don't get the 18", get bigger. I'm weigh 165 lbs normal build and I have a very difficult time cutting padlocks. Luckily neighbor's gardener lend me a hand and he cut it with a lot of effort. He weighed well over 220.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value
customer_reviews.text: Good tool, incredible value. I got one to cut wire closet shelving, which it did nicely. These are not Knipex quality, the handles in particular seem like a weak point as they are steel tubing rather than solid/forged. But to their credit, they have held up fine for me. If you're not using these to earn a living and you need a good pair of cutters to keep around the house, just buy these. For the money you can't beat em.
customer_reviews.author: Hampton

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly efficient!
customer_reviews.text: Used these to cut off a master lock. I'm a female without alot of upper body strength so I'd ordered some more expensive 24" cutters as well that were going to take a while to be shipped. These were just a cheap hope to work alternative that I wasnt optimistic about. Well they cut through that lock like it was nothing!! Dont waste your money on more expensive cutters when these will do the trick!!
customer_reviews.author: redsonya

customer_reviews.title: Works great for smaller projects and locks
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to break a lock that was on a locker at a new property. It worked with a bit of force for a small master lock. I will be useful in the future. It handles soft metal very well and hardened steel up to 1/4 inch (with force)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use in my bike shop when I am mounting fenders. Cuts the fender stays easily and cleanly. Able to get the tip into a tight spot where required. Much better than removing the stays and using a saw.
customer_reviews.author: DitzMan

customer_reviews.text: First time I used them cutting an old car antenna they get damage on the blade a car antenna is not that thick for that to happen They look well made but I’m just not impressed I’ll cut more stuff and see what happens
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: They work Great!
customer_reviews.text: Took them right out of the box and used them. It was a Master combination lock, stamped in the hasp was " harden steel". They cut right though it like butter. Love them. Best damn pair I've owned. I'll buy again, when I wear these out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Even with rheumatoid arthritis, I could cut through a heavy duty metal clip easily!
customer_reviews.text: Just got it and went outside and used it immediately for the purpose I purchased it for and I am very happy! I was worried I wouldn't have enough upper body strength to actually cut through the metal because I have R.A., but it actually cut relatively easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kermittreefrog

customer_reviews.title: Work nice
customer_reviews.text: These aren’t even that big of bolt cutters but I cut through a standard gym style lock fairly easily, which I was surprised by. If I was gonna use these specific for cutting hardened steel locks I’d probably go a bit bigger but these will snip some smaller locks pretty simply.
customer_reviews.author: Butch Williamson Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a pass key ? This is it.
customer_reviews.text: Owning a self Storage facility, occasionally you need a pass key. This is the one you want. I bought this for home as I had to cut up several pieces of #750 chain. This did the trick easily. Will cut locks if needed as well. Heavy duty and long handles for leverage.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Well made for a cheap bolt cutter
customer_reviews.text: Used for cutting ingrown stumps out of chain-link fence. Fit, finish and machining better thsn other cheap bolt cutters I've seen.
customer_reviews.author: NJBuyer2

customer_reviews.title: Cuts through wire remesh like butter.
customer_reviews.text: These are heavy duty. Makes easy work of snipping wire, remesh, neighbor's barb wire fence, the pesky chain link fence that always blocks my dirt bikes from going to cool places. It does a great job!
customer_reviews.author: Jason B.

customer_reviews.title: Love these little Monsters
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to cut up temporary construction fences, a task which they perform admirably. Granted this is only 14 gauge (1/16th of an inch), so they make for quick easy work. Nice build quality.
customer_reviews.author: roninscholar

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my uses
customer_reviews.text: I'm not using this thing every day but it worked great for cutting some chains to length for a couple projects. Handles were nice and long enough to provide leverage to cut the chain with relative ease.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: I used this 18 inch bolt cutter to cut mattress springs
customer_reviews.text: I used this 18 inch bolt cutter to break down and dispose of an very old queen size mattress. I had to cut the mattress in half in order to easily bring it downstairs. I used a box butter to cut the exterior fabric then used the bolt cutter to cut the springs. It worked well.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Works on fencing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to cut what seems to be 1/4” livestock fencing for tomato cages. I also hoped it would work for white wire shelving as i use that a lot. Works great, cuts neatly and smoothly. For the size, heft, and price, i found this quite satisfactory for small house jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy M. Cefaratti

customer_reviews.title: Great little cutter for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with this cutter. I bought it to cut medium weight chain for an outdoor project. It cut through the links with almost no effort. I would buy it again and would refer to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Mac

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Should have bought at least 24" cutter for any normal padlock.
customer_reviews.author: C. Thew

customer_reviews.title: Great nail cutter.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cut thick nails protruding through my floor. It works quite well however you do need some muscle power for the thickest one.
customer_reviews.author: deadeye

customer_reviews.title: Good for Cutting Wire Shelving
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these bolt cutters to cut wire shelving to size for a project. They worked perfectly with a little elbow grease on my end. The cutting surface looks good as new even after use, which is awesome. I hope to have these in service for a few years, at least.
customer_reviews.author: Breanne P.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use even for a 73 yr old lady
customer_reviews.text: Even if your hands aren't too strong anymore these bolt cutters are still pretty easy to use. I have had no trouble with them at all even thought I am now pretty .. ok really .... old and not strong at all.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for those lacking upper body strength
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to remove a luggage lock and a metal tag that has been on my rug since I bought it, three years ago. Worked fine, my arms are like spaghetti and I was able to clip right through the metal like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Cut wire and metal
customer_reviews.text: Using these to cut wire fencing from around young trees. This requires multiple cuts and was a real effort with heavy clippers I had. Bought these and turned the job into a pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: James Godshalk

customer_reviews.title: Great for cutting through chain link fence
customer_reviews.text: These bolt cutters worked great when we had to take a part a fence in order to remove a bush that got tangled up with it. No issues cutting through the chain link fence whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Kali

customer_reviews.title: Works for what I need
customer_reviews.text: Cut easily through a hog panel, have not tried it on case hardened, but I didn't buy it for that.
customer_reviews.author: Name withheld to protect the innocent

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does the job well. Hell of an investment for $15.
customer_reviews.author: 916hammer

customer_reviews.title: Oh ya, this is the cutter i needed.
customer_reviews.text: dont have much to say other than i had 4 guage wire that needed cutting and this is the only cutter that could do it that i currently have. it takes a little bit of a wiggle but it gets the job done. good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Zak G.

customer_reviews.title: Cuts smoothly through chain link fence.
customer_reviews.text: Read some of the other reviews and chose these bolt cutter to cut a chain link fence that had grown through an evergreen tree. If this granny can do it, you can too.
customer_reviews.author: DesertGal

customer_reviews.title: Made my life easier
customer_reviews.text: For years i used a 5 inch cutter for my gardening projects, galvanized fence, chicken wires, etc and its getting dull so i was shopping for a replacement when i saw this workpro bolt cutter. First thing i cut when i got it was wardrobe shelving for my garden stand , a little bit harder for senior like me but i put it on the ground and pushed 1 handle of the cutter down, it worked. I tried it with wire fence, like what they say, it cut like butter. I'm glad i discovered this amazing tool.
customer_reviews.author: L. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I’m doing a project at the house and needed to cut through a metal basket that some prior installers had threaded Ethernet cable through (for some reason). I knew bolt cutters would do the trick but haven’t needed them in the past and wasn’t sure I’d use them much in the future, so I bought the smaller version 14in. Worked great. Took some elbow grease and had to give it a few goes, but did the job. Impressed the small cutters I bought could do this. Money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: WORKPRO W017004A Bolt Cutter, Bi-Material Handle with Soft Rubber Grip, 14", Chrome Molybdenum Steel Blade
product_meta.description: Size:14"This WORKPRO bolt Cutter is featured with molybdenum steel jaws, compound cutting action requires less effort. Bi-material soft handle for comfortable cutting.
feature_bullets: Note: cutting locks is not recommended
Drop forged chrome molybdenum steel and powder coated jaws for sure, efficient cutting and long life. Ergonomic bi-material Anti-slip grips provide greater control and comfort in cutting
Classic lever-fulcrum design and precisely aligned blades deliver added leverage with less effort
Ideal for cutting soft metal, bolts, rods, rivets and chain

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,400 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
